intro: Erythroxylum fischeri var. heckmannianum, commonly known as the Ecuadorian copal tree, is a species of flowering plant in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of Ecuador and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, red bracteate flowers. The plant is often found in humid, lowland tropical forests and is adapted to grow in shaded environments. It produces a milky sap that has been used traditionally for various purposes, including medicinal applications. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
